explanation.rules:
Rules:
• Word order:
  – V P (S/O)
  – S/O P V Poss
  – V P Poss
  – S Poss
• V = verb (past → future suffix shift: ‑bi → ‑ba, Ø → ‑jba).
• S = subject (noun); the subject of a transitive verb takes ‑ni.
• O = object (noun).
• P = pronouns (subject + object) + tense:
  – Subject prefixes
      * 1st  ngV‑
      * 2nd  nyV‑
      * 3rd  intransitive gV‑; transitive: masculine gVnV‑, feminine ngVyV‑
  – Object suffixes
      * 1st  ‑ngV
      * 2nd  ‑nyV
      * 3rd  Ø
  – V stands for the tense vowel (past: i…i,a; future: u…u).
• Poss = possessed noun:
  – possessed ‘+’  → ‑ngu
  – possessed ‘‑’  → ‑wa
  – possessor markers: masculine ‑ji, feminine ‑nya

P = pronouns (subject + object) + tense: Object suffixes: 1st -ngV, 2nd -nyV, 3rd
